channel.title: FLF - Business300
channel.description: FIGHT LAUGH FEAST PRESENTS SHOWS PROCLAIMING THE LORDSHIP OF CHRIST OVER ALL OF LIFE.
channel.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Ep. 126 - 2 Types of Customer Relationships [Business300]
item.description: A business needs a customer the way a husband needs a wife – it’s what defines the role. I’d like to propose a different sort of distinction to identify and pursue your target audience, one that is relevant in both B2B and B2C scenarios. Building a trustworthy relationship is less about customer service and more about the strategy, structure, and systems that drive your business and deliver a reliable customer experience. To your customers, you are either transactional or trustworthy. Which sort of relationship are you cultivating out of these 2 types of customer relationships?
item.author: Philip Kulishov
item.itunes:author: Philip Kulishov

item.title: Ep. 125 - Protect Your Brand From Your Customers [Business300]
item.description: A business’s brand is not what the owner says it is, nor is it what the social media image portrays. A business’s brand is what the outside world says it is.Good or bad, a reputation is unavoidable. There are times when you must protect your brand from your customer.
item.author: Philip Kulishov
item.itunes:author: Philip Kulishov
item.itunes:summary: A business’s brand is not what the owner says it is, nor is it what the social media image portrays. A business’s brand is what the outside world says it is.Good or bad, a reputation is unavoidable. There are times when you must protect your brand from your customer.

item.title: Ep. 124 - Value-Growth Mindset [Business300]
item.description: The fundamental framework – the mindset – that ought to drive all of our actions as we work in and on the business is the Value-Growth Mindset. The Value-Growth Mindset is caring to make people’s lives better. Progress and innovation moves forward because people do good for other people. A business is the tool we use to deliver not just value, but growing value, to our customers.
item.author: Philip Kulishov
item.itunes:author: Philip Kulishov

item.title: Ep. 123 - Value Is The Goal [Business300]
item.description: A business exists to deliver value to a customer. Anything else is a distraction from that goal, and will lead to your business’ demise. If something else takes the place of the customer, the customer eventually leaves. And without a customer, you don’t have a business. That’s because the business is not the goal of the business. Value is the goal.
item.author: Philip Kulishov
